hanzi-su-wiki:
島

Значения

Остров

Мнемоника


Птица 鳥 присела на горе 山 отдохнуть, а вокруг — гладь моря, негде глаз остановить.

Варианты

岛, 嶋, 嶌, 嶹, 㠀, 陦, 隯, 隝, 﨩

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 岛)
Ideographic: A bird 烏 perched atop a mountain 山
purpleculture_examples: 島嶼 [ dǎo yǔ ]: island
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿹ Surround from upper right
    • 烏 [ wū ] crow, rook, raven; black, dark
    • 山 [ shān ] mountain, hill, peak
heisig_chinese_memo: This island is the home of the terrible mythical bird Roc. It sits mighty atop the mountain waiting for the next hapless ship to pass by.
heisig_story: The bird's tail is tucked under here, because it has come to stop on a mountain to rest from its journey across the waters. Thus the kanji comes to mean an island.
koohiiStory1: This island is the home of the terrible mythical bird Roc. It sits mighty atop the mountain waiting for the next hapless ship to pass by.
koohiiStory2: Birds living on remote mountainous islands have few preditors. Tail feathers aren´t really needed are they? Evolutionary process at work!...　RTK2:　トウ　半島　はんとう(peninsula).
jp_example_words:
半島(はんとう): peninsula
列島(れっとう): chain of islands
島(しま): island
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A bird sits upon a mountain. If you look at the radicals, the bird is quite large and the mountain quite small. Think of this in the mnemonic as well. The reason the mountain is small is because you can only see the top of it, sticking out of the water. On it is the bird. This small mountain with the bird on it is an island.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine the mountain as small as you'd like. Maybe it's only barely sticking out of the sea, and the bird is having trouble standing on it. Whatever you do, make sure you think of it as an island, possibly owned by the bird.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: But this island doesn't only belong to the bird. In fact, the bird shouldn't be on this island, because it belongs to She-Man (しま), He-Man's girlfriend. She-Man comes out of the water and grabs the bird, eats it, and then goes back into the sea from whence she came.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: I don't think She-Man is a real character, but you can make up this imaginary He-Man girlfriend in your mind. She is weird about her island, and weird about eating birds, but He-Man and She-Man are in love, so why are you judging? Imagine the two having dinner on their small island later that evening. He-Man wonders where she got the bird from.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the mountain (山) you reach (丂) that's white (白) is an island
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This bird is resting comfortably on top of the island mountain.
humanum_full_description_en:
"㠀" can be written as "嶋" with left and right structure from the sound of " mountain " and " bird ", and the four points that evolved from the bird's foot are written as " island ". " Island " from " mountain ", " bird " saves the sound. The original meaning is land that can stay and live in the sea. "Shuowen": "Island, there are often mountains in the sea, and you can rely on it." "Shi Ming. Release Water: "Those who can live in the sea are called islands." Such as "Shang Shu. "Yugong": "Island Yi leather clothing, clip right Jieshi into the river." "Book of the Later Han Dynasty. "The Biography of Zhang Fateng and Feng Duyang": "If a thief floats on a boat and goes deep into the remote island, it will not be easy to attack." Northern Song Dynasty Su Shi's "Magnolia Order": "Thousands of families travel to Chuntai, ten miles of fairy islands."

" Island " and " Island " meaning near, but the " island " of relatively large area. Such as "Historical Records. "The Biographies of Tian Dan": "Tian Heng was afraid of punishment, and more than 500 people who belonged to him entered the sea and lived on the island." Tian Heng led more than 500 people to move to the island. Another example is "The Book of Later Han Dynasty. "The Biography of Dongyi": "The Japanese live in the sea in the southeast of South Korea. They live on the mountain and island. There are more than one hundred countries." The Japanese can establish a nation on the island. " Island " is a small island, such as Xu Jing in the Northern Song Dynasty "Xuanhe Envoy of Gaoli Picture Scripture": "Niu Xinyu is in the small ocean, a peak rises, and the shape is covered with a bowl and the center is slightly sharp." Another example is "Selected Works. Xie Lingyun "Lantau Island in the Dengjiang River": "The turbulent current tends to be normal, and Lantau enchants Zhongchuan." " Island " means a big rock protruding in the river. See " Island ".
humanum_short_description_en: From " mountain " to " bird ", save the sound. The original meaning is land that can stay and live in the sea.
humanum_full_description:
「㠀」從「山」，「鳥」聲，又可寫為左右結構的「嶋」，後省去鳥足演變而來的四點寫作「島」。「島」從「山」，「鳥」省聲。本義是海中可停留、居住的陸地。《說文》：「島，海中往往有山可依止曰㠀。」《釋名．釋水》：「海中可居者曰島。」如《尚書．禹貢》：「島夷皮服，夾右碣石入于河。」《後漢書．張法滕馮度楊列傳》：「賊若乘船浮海，深入遠島，攻之未易也。」北宋蘇軾〈木蘭花令〉：「萬家游賞上春臺，十里神仙迷海島。」

　　「島」和「嶼」義近，但「島」的面積相對較大。如《史記．田儋列傳》：「田橫懼誅，而與其徒屬五百餘人入海，居島中。」田橫率五百多人移居海島。又如《後漢書．東夷列傳》：「倭在韓東南大海中，依山島為居，凡百餘國。」倭人可在島上建國。「嶼」則是小島，如北宋徐兢《宣和奉使高麗圖經》：「牛心嶼在小洋中，一峰特起，狀類覆盂而中稍銳。」又如《文選．謝靈運〈登江中孤嶼〉》：「亂流趨正絕，孤嶼媚中川。」「嶼」表示河川中突出的大石。參見「嶼」。
humanum_short_description: 從「山」，「鳥」省聲。本義是海中可停留、居住的陸地。

「 㠀 」從「 山 」，「 鳥 」聲，又可寫為左右結構的「 嶋 」，後省去鳥足演變而來的四點寫作「 島 」。「 島 」從「 山 」，「 鳥 」省聲。本義是海中可停留、居住的陸地。《說文》：「島，海中往往有山可依止曰㠀。」《釋名．釋水》：「海中可居者曰島。」如《尚書．禹貢》：「島夷皮服，夾右碣石入于河。」《後漢書．張法滕馮度楊列傳》：「賊若乘船浮海，深入遠島，攻之未易也。」北宋蘇軾〈木蘭花令〉：「萬家游賞上春臺，十里神仙迷海島。」 「 島 」和「 嶼 」義近，但「 島 」的面積相對較大。如《史記．田儋列傳》：「田橫懼誅，而與其徒屬五百餘人入海，居島中。」田橫率五百多人移居海島。又如《後漢書．東夷列傳》：「倭在韓東南大海中，依山島為居，凡百餘國。」倭人可在島上建國。「 嶼 」則是小島，如北宋徐兢《宣和奉使高麗圖經》：「牛心嶼在小洋中，一峰特起，狀類覆盂而中稍銳。」又如《文選．謝靈運〈登江中孤嶼〉》：「亂流趨正絕，孤嶼媚中川。」「 嶼 」表示河川中突出的大石。參見「 嶼 」。
" 㠀" can be written as " 嶋" with left and right structure from the sound of " mountain" and " bird", and the four points that evolved from the bird's foot are written as " island". " Island" from " mountain", " bird" saves the sound. The original meaning is land that can stay and live in the sea. "Shuowen": "Island, there are often mountains in the sea, and you can rely on it." "Shi Ming. Release Water: "Those who can live in the sea are called islands." Such as "Shang Shu. "Yugong": "Island Yi leather clothing, clip right Jieshi into the river." "Book of the Later Han Dynasty. "The Biography of Zhang Fateng and Feng Duyang": "If a thief floats on a boat and goes deep into the remote island, it will not be easy to attack." Northern Song Dynasty Su Shi's "Magnolia Order": "Thousands of families travel to Chuntai, ten miles of fairy islands." " Island" and " Island" meaning near, but the " island" of relatively large area. Such as "Historical Records. "The Biographies of Tian Dan": "Tian Heng was afraid of punishment, and more than 500 people who belonged to him entered the sea and lived on the island." Tian Heng led more than 500 people to move to the island. Another example is "The Book of Later Han Dynasty. "The Biography of Dongyi": "The Japanese live in the sea in the southeast of South Korea. They live on the mountain and island. There are more than one hundred countries." The Japanese can establish a nation on the island. " Island" is a small island, such as Xu Jing in the Northern Song Dynasty "Xuanhe Envoy of Gaoli Picture Scripture": "Niu Xinyu is in the small ocean, a peak rises, and the shape is covered with a bowl and the center is slightly sharp." Another example is "Selected Works. Xie Lingyun "Lantau Island in the Dengjiang River": "The turbulent current tends to be normal, and Lantau enchants Zhongchuan." " Island" means a big rock protruding in the river. See " Island".

島字的基本解释

島
dǎo
见“岛”。

島字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dǎo］
［《廣韻》都晧切，上晧，端。］
亦作“嶋1”。“岛1”的繁体字。亦作“隝1”。亦作“隯1”。亦作“鳥3”。亦作“1”。
(1)海洋及江、湖中被水环绕的陆地。
(2)姓。明代有举人岛璞。见《正字通·山部》。

島字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【山字部】　島； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页312第04
【唐韻】【廣韻】【正韻】都皓切【集韻】【韻會】都老切，?刀上聲。【說文】海中往往有山可依止曰島。从山鳥聲。《釋名》島，到也。人所奔到也。《書•禹貢》島夷皮服。孔傳海曲謂之島。居島之夷還服其皮。【木華•海賦】崇島巨鼇。　又【集韻】或作隯。【張衡•西京賦】長風激於別隯。亦作嶹。　【集韻】古通鳥。，从山鳥聲。

考證：〔【說文】海中有山可依止曰島。島，到也，人所奔到也。从山，烏省聲。【書·禹貢】島夷卉服。【註】海曲曰島，卉草也，木棉之屬，以卉服來貢也。〕　謹按所引多與原文不符，謹照各書原文改作：說文海中往往有山可依止曰島。从山鳥聲。釋名島，到也。人所奔到也。書禹貢島夷皮服。孔傳海曲謂之島。居島之夷還服其皮。〔【木華·海賦】崇島巨鰲。〕　謹按鼇从黽，不从魚。照海賦原文改鼇。

暂无。

dǎo
вм. 岛

島

Значения

Остров

Мнемоника


Птица 鳥 присела на горе 山 отдохнуть, а вокруг — гладь моря, негде глаз остановить.

Варианты

岛, 嶋, 嶌, 嶹, 㠀, 陦, 隯, 隝, 﨩

Radicals: 鳥, 山  (bird, mountain)
Meaning Mnemonic
A bird sits upon a mountain. If you look at the radicals, the bird is quite large and the mountain quite small. Think of this in the mnemonic as well. The reason the mountain is small is because you can only see the top of it, sticking out of the water. On it is the bird. This small mountain with the bird on it is an island.
Imagine the mountain as small as you'd like. Maybe it's only barely sticking out of the sea, and the bird is having trouble standing on it. Whatever you do, make sure you think of it as an island, possibly owned by the bird.
Reading Mnemonic
But this island doesn't only belong to the bird. In fact, the bird shouldn't be on this island, because it belongs to She-Man (しま), He-Man's girlfriend. She-Man comes out of the water and grabs the bird, eats it, and then goes back into the sea from whence she came.
I don't think She-Man is a real character, but you can make up this imaginary He-Man girlfriend in your mind. She is weird about her island, and weird about eating birds, but He-Man and She-Man are in love, so why are you judging? Imagine the two having dinner on their small island later that evening. He-Man wonders where she got the bird from.

Examples: 島 (しま)
山 (гора), 白 (белый), 鳥 (птица)
Реже: 嶋 (しま、トウ остров).
